You are given a string $s$ of lowercase English letters.  Find a string $t$ of the same length that meets the following conditions:

* $t$ does not contain any palindromic substrings of length 3 or greater.
* $t$ is lexicographically larger than $s$.
* Among all strings that meet the above conditions, $t$ is lexicographically smallest.

If no such string exists, print "Impossible".

Given a string, find a longer string with the same number of characters that comes after it alphabetically and doesn't contain any palindromes (reads the same backward as forward) longer than a given length. If no such string exists, say "Impossible".
